result.value:
TIMSCONVERT is a workflow designed for mass spectrometrists that allows for the conversion of raw data from Bruker 
timsTOF Pro and fleX mass spectrometers (i.e. .d directory containing BAF, TDF, and TSF files) to open source 
data formats (i.e. mzML and imzML) that:
1. are compatible with downstream open source data analysis platorms.
2. incorporate trapped ion mobility spectrometry (TIMS) data into these open source formats.
3. do not require any programming experience. 
Gordon T. Luu, Michael A. Freitas, Itzel Lizama-Chamu, Catherine S. McCaughey, Laura M. Sanchez, Mingxun Wang. (2022). 
TIMSCONVERT: A workflow to convert trapped ion mobility data to open formats. *Bioinformatics*; btac419. 
doi: [10.1093/bioinformatics/btac419](https://doi.org/10.1093/bioinformatics/btac419). 
For more information about timsTOF data formats and TIMSCONVERT, see the 
[documentation](https://gtluu.github.io/timsconvert/).

Installation instructions are linked below:
- [Windows](https://gtluu.github.io/timsconvert/installation.html#installing-on-windows)
- [Linux](https://gtluu.github.io/timsconvert/installation.html#installing-on-linux)

Unfortunately, macOS is not compatible with the Bruker TDF-SDK API that is necessary to run TIMSCONVERT.

result.description: - specify specific tags for pyimzml, pytdfsdk, pybaf2sql
result.name: v1.6.5

result.description: - specify specific tags for pyimzml, pytdfsdk, pybaf2sql
result.name: v1.6.4

result.description: - fix bug where imzML spectra are missing centroid/profile CVParams
result.name: v1.6.3

result.description:
- bug fixes for mobility array presence
- add check to ensure only one analysis.* file is present within a .d directory
- remove unused constants
- move BAF/TSF/TDF data parsing code to [pyBaf2Sql](https://github.com/gtluu/pyBaf2Sql) and [pyTDFSDK](https://github.com/gtluu/pyTDFSDK)
- add constant for VIP-HESI source
- various documentation updates for the above changes
result.name: v1.6.2

result.description: - Bug fix for log filename incompatibility with Windows file system due to the inclusion of colons in ISO 8601 timestamps (and therefore the inclusion of colons in the log filename).
result.name: v1.5.1

result.description:
- add documentation using sphinx
- add docstrings to functions
- refactor class names to fit PEP standards
- move argument descriptions to json and update args_check()
- remove misc unused parameters from functions
- remove TDF-SDK files from TIMSCONVERT and pull functions and base classes from pyTDFSDK and pyBaf2Sql
- misc updates to setup files and installation documentation
- fix bug when checking whether binary arrays are empty
- add CVParams for instrument name (i.e. "timsTOF fleX", "timsTOF Ultra", etc.); timsTOF HT will be added as a "Bruker Daltonics timsTOF series"
- add run start time to run attributes
- update detector CVParam
- add serial number CVParam
- add MSMS activation method CVParam supported by stock instrument configuration to MSMS spectra
- update acquisition software in software list
- add TDF-SDK and TIMSCONVERT to software and data processing lists
- update dependencies for compatibility with Python 3.11 (tested on Windows 10 and Ubuntu 22.04.3 LTS)
- update documentation and Dockerfile to use Python 3.11 instead of 3.7
- add environment files for to create conda venv with in Windows 10 and Ubuntu 22.04.3 LTS
result.name: v1.5.0

result.description:
- add support for various acquisition modes in otofControl and timsControl for both ESI and MALDI acquisition modes
- including but not limited to diaPASEF, bbCID, MRM, prmPASEF, isCID
- improved speed of parsing algorithm for TIMS datasets from TDF files
- phase out tdf2mzml backend; support for relevant tdf2mzml features have been rolled into timsconvert
- update TDF-SDK to version 22.1.0.4
result.name: v1.3.1

result.description:
- remove some redundant code in parsing and output writing functions
- fix error where MALDI data listed electrospray as the source
- add support for LC-TIMS-MS data with PASEF disabled (TIMS-MS1 only runs)
- update nextflow script
- enable profile mode data binning
result.name: v1.2.0

result.description:
- added various versions of tdfsdk
- added support for imzML
- added multiple output options for MALDI dried droplet data
- added support for BAF files (for non-TIMS data acquired in otofControl)
- integrated tdf2mzml
- added server/client code for GNPS instance support
- added testing makefiles
- added various metadata options for output files
- various bug fixes
result.name: v1.1.2

result.description:
v 1.0.0
- Initial release.
- Compatibility for ESI and MALDI based experiments.
result.name: v1.0.0

result.value:
The [web version of TIMSCONVERT](https://proteomics2.ucsd.edu/ProteoSAFe/index.jsp?params=%7b%22workflow%22%3A%20%22TIMSCONVERT%22%7d) 
currently supports various data formats listed below. No installation is necessary. All that's required is a GNPS 
account. Usage instructions can be found [here](https://gtluu.github.io/timsconvert/gnps.html).

The CLI version of TIMSCONVERT supports conversion of all experimental data types specified above. The 
```timsconvert``` command can be used to run TIMSCONVERT. Unless specified, all other default values for all other 
parameters will be used.

```
timsconvert --input [path to data]
```

Depending on the size of your data/number of files, TIMSCONVERT may take some time to finish conversion.

See the documentation for more details on [running TIMSCONVERT locally](https://gtluu.github.io/timsconvert/local.html),
a description of the CLI [parameters](https://gtluu.github.io/timsconvert/local.html#parameters), 
and [advanced usage](https://gtluu.github.io/timsconvert/advanced.html) (i.e. Docker, Nextflow).
